lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've got some cool stuff to talk about. First and foremost, we have two sponsors tonight. Our first sponsor-- and we're going into, for a time, a cool partnership with the folks at DnD Beyond, actually. They've been really awesome, and we've been talking, and anybody who hasn't seen it, it's an online digital tool where you can create your own D&D character, they have options to purchase any of the current D&D books out there, and then carry over any of the character options and racial options over into it, so you can basically use it as a tool. We'll be using it to help us out in the game as we go, 'cause it's actually got some pretty cool stuff. So excited about that. It is D-N-D Beyond, by the way, if you haven't seen, not the ampersand. It's D-N-D.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As in nnnn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nnnn. But yeah, so they're going to be a long-term partner for the show, so working with us through the start of this campaign. We're super excited. But yeah. So we're excited. You can currently activate-- it should be now-- some Critical Role content on there. They should have available the Blood Hunter class that I created a couple of years ago, kind of refining. Should be available for you guys to find on the DnD Beyond, which I'm excited about, and there's a one-time discount of $10 off any digital book in the dndbeyond.com marketplace if you use the codeword 'beginnings' in there right now. So yeah, get a chance to check it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (vomiting noises) Would you like some?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. I'm super excited to have that, guys. So you apply that code at checkout to make that happen, in case you're confused and trying to get it to work. There's a bunch of stuff to explore on there, and a bunch of cool ways to incorporate the existing breadth of D&D lore and options in there, and now you have some of our stuff in there as well, and hopefully more Critical Role content and Tal'Dorei content and Exandria content down the road to also be available on there as we go. Super excited about that. I'd like to thank you guys at DnD Beyond for being awesome. We also have our second sponsor. Sam, if you want to take it away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Sam!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's made out of English brown oak, the center Critical Role inlay is made of ash burl, is the background, and then rosewood for the d20 outline, wenge for the Critical Role words themselves, and silver stringing around the border. It was built by hand in their Massachusetts office and workshop, and it was hand-rubbed oil on a wax finish. Over a hundred hours were put into this table. They did an incredible job, and we're super honored to have that here, and thank you guys for showing such an awesome appreciation for what we do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It smells really nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have cubbies!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It smells like wood in the studio, like fresh wood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And, when we get canceled, this is going to be a great dining room table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura, do you have an update for merch stuff in the new year?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (yells) Okay. Yes, I do. It's a new campaign, new us, new merch. I don't know which camera I'm looking at.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we released our teaser on socials, and everybody was like, "I want that as a poster!" So we listened to you, and we made it a poster! (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a real poster?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a real poster!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at this lameness that you could have on your wall! So yeah. It's in the store right now, you guys, and we printed a small amount, so those ones will be shipped faster, and then after that it'll just be pre-order, but I think it's all listed as pre-order, so just so you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you photoshop out my crotch region?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be a lot of photoshop, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of us have that much talent in post, Sam.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But let's just talk about this Matthew Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's not talk about what I-- when I put that outfit on, I did not consider quite the permeation in my life it would become. So there's that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can be with you always. Matt can stare at you while you sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's actually how Purvon dressed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: God damn it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey, first throwback! Well done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah. We've got to be careful, guys, because we have a lot of people that haven't watched the last campaign, or haven't finished the last campaign, so no spoilers for last campaign.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't really remember it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we all died, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true, yeah. Okay, next announcements: the Critical Role podcast we have currently up to date. All of Vox Machina's story, the whole first campaign, is now on the podcast. You can find it where the finest podcasts are downloaded. And do we have an update as far as the release schedule for this podcast?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we do. They will be releasing one week after we are live. We'll be one week behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a Thursday?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They will be releasing on Thursdays the week after.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so you can listen to it in the morning and watch it live at night. If you have a lot of free time. Or a really long drive, maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An extra eight hours to spend every Thursday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To be fair, you guys would have about as much free time on a Thursday as I would. Cool, so look forward to that. Comic book, issue four of Critical Role: Vox Machina Origins, Liam, when does that come out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is coming out on the 24th of this month.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, make it sooner!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've read it. It's so good, it's real good, it's so good. You guys, Vox Machina's story ended at this table, but it is going to live on and on and on-- at least for three more issues.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Check it out everywhere.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, on Zune, on PalmPilot. Darkhorse app, Comixology, Limewire, finally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Napster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to throw up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll be there tomorrow until Sunday. If you guys are in the area, come say hi at the convention. It should be fun. I have panels and signings and stuff. Hopefully see you there. Also, I'll be at Lexington Comic and Toy Con in Lexington, Kentucky, March 9-11, Otafest in Calgary, May 18-20, and A-Kon in Texas, June 7-10.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jeez Louise, Matt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have Emerald City Comic Con, me and Travis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First weekend of March.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He actually painted me and Marisha's cake toppers for our wedding, and whenever you manage to see them in the campaign, you can know that it's his handiwork. Soon enough.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love it. So you can follow him, @PaintingTusk on Twitter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's amazing at what he does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for bearing with us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, we're going to give-- oh, that's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Afterwards.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's one more announcement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our announcement is our brand-new opening title sequence. Which I think we're ready for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was a new level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. So.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, super fast. We've got to go through credits. Right? Okay. So normally we don't do this, and I did this once before when we released our other opening title sequence. Yeah, 50th. So we're going to do this again. These are just people who do so much and who do not get enough love. I'm going to shout them out. Sean Becker, who's the unsung hero of Geek and Sundry, he's the executive producer. T.J. Rotell, he's our production manager around here, he makes sure that we actually have cameras. Maxwell James, our producer that makes this show go every week. Dani Carr, our production coordinator, also huge producer here. Steve Sprinkles, who directed that amazing opening title sequence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not a real name!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I love it on the slate. It always says 'Sprinkles'. Jan-Michael Losada, who is our D.P., and is the same D.P. from last time. Tristan Savage-Tate, our first A.C. Sean Delahunt, who is our key grip. Tyler Hart, who is our gaffer, who gaffs everything around here, he's amazing. Jenny Newman, who did the amazing wardrobe. She sourced all the wardrobe. Wren Witting, who's one of our hair and makeup artists. Vanessa Marie, who is our second hair and makeup artist. Jose Sosa, who was our production assistant. Selina Ruthe--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a lot of pieces of paper!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. Selina Ruthe, who did additional photography, and she also does stuff every day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why didn't you put them on the same piece of paper?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I didn't know there was going to be this many. Brandon Clark, who was our location manager. Pamela Joy, who shot all the photos for that, and Loretta Ritchert.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they're with Heirloom Photography, and they did all of our thumbnails, too. They did that poster.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Go check them out on Instagram!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jason Charles Miller, who does our music.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Party on, Garthok!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sean Hudson, who does our post-production. And Andy Inglat, who edited that thing. Okay. I'm sweating a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. So.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What a night. Well, guys...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This has been great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we open our fricking books yet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Emerging 13 generations before, the Dwendalian Empire has slowly spread to encompass the surrounding societies of the region, absorbing the peoples of the Zemni Fields and the Marrow Valley, before finally conquering the Julous Dominion and taking the whole of Western Wynandir for the Empire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There will be no test.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (nervous laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, no pressure!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were we supposed to prepare this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pretty filthy. I have a mess of reddish-brown hair, and really filthy road clothes. I wear a long coat that I slept in. I slept about 20 hours last night. Jeez. Unshaven, a bit of a mess.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So far you're just talking about current Liam.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What color are your eyes? I need visual.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're blue. That's it. It was a rough day yesterday, and-- that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And your name is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Caleb. Caleb Widogast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As your smaller friend curls awake, Sam, would you like to describe your character?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am a goblin. So, you know, the green skin, the green hair, the yellow eyes. And she wears not-great clothes, just like her traveling companion there. She hides in the shadows a lot, because she knows goblins aren't welcome in this part, and that's about it. I mean, she's a little skittish, and right now she's probably stirring awake as well, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well. What's your name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Nott the Brave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Caleb, as you come to consciousness, you glance over and can see, slowly snoring and rousing at about the same time, Nott's eyes blink open, her slowly groaning face looking over towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (high-pitched Cockney accent) Oh! You're finally awake, I see. Oh yeah, motherfuckers. It's on. You were out for quite some time, there. Rough day, eh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (light German accent) Not our best day, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I mean, usually you're so good at everything, but yesterday you were just-- maybe you needed the sleep, is what you needed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, don't thank me yet. I should probably tell you what happened while you were asleep. I mean, you were asleep for so long. I got bored, frankly. I was going through my pack and reorganizing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has anybody seen you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've never slept that long, so I left, I went downstairs, I thought I'd do a bit of window-shopping, and you know how sometimes I get the itch, you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do. Did you make it back here okay, at night?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm here, aren't I?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I did. But I might have been spotted by a few of the Crown's Guard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you have the mask on?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No? No, I didn't. But they didn't catch me, so. Listen, I'm sorry, sometimes I get the urge, I've got to take something, you know? I was trying to replentish what you lost yesterday, and I failed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we-- (sighs)-- discussed coming to a bigger town. It's going to be a little more difficult now. You can't go-- it was easier on outskirts, it was easier in farms, but we can't do that here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, I think today you should have the mask on at all times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, good idea, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's better when we're working together. If you need to steal something, do it with my help, all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, of course. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back up the conversation a minute. Thank you. I would not be alive if you had not-- you saved my life. So thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, no problem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yesterday was really not great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, well, we'll do better today, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. Sure we will. Are you hungry?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm starving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you notice the gentle smell of cooked meats and promises of mediocre porridge and eggs just barely begins to creep beneath the subtle floor of your room, meet your nostrils.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, Nott, what are we going to do today? I can go down and get breakfast and bring it up here. At least-- I don't know. I mean, I'm a little wary of just splashing back into the town right away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we'll take it from there. You need some books and stuff, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Always.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, well, that's on the to-do list.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well, let's get something to eat, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you prepare yourself with your mask set over?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yeah, so I have a half a mask that covers my goblin face, and with the hood over, kind of obscures. Maybe it's not a goblin, maybe it's a little halfling person or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a faint bit of music as two slovenly-looking musicians in the corner are trying to work for tips with a small hat on the floor that it looks like nobody's thrown any coin into it. The tables are fairly busy, except for maybe two that appear to be available between the two of you guys, if you'd like to find a seat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Sure. Is that easy to do, find a seat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this how D&D works?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we roll for? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You sit down, and due to the chaos that ensues around you, it takes a little while for Adelaine, the red-headed barmaid, to come by, and she scoots by the table. "I'm terribly sorry. What "can I get you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, meat if you have it, but if you don't, that's okay, too. Potatoes, or bacon if it's on the menu, but really anything--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can get you all three, it's fine. What you want?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A Trost for each of us, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For breakfast? I like you. All right, two Trosts and a bunch of meats. Be right back." And she rushes off, she pulls her hair back and ties it as she goes into the kitchen, getting ready for the midst of chaos. While you guys have a moment there at the table, you can hear conversation muttering around you, and you have a brief bit of privacy to discuss.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I need books, that's true, but did you find drink yesterday?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a little left in my flask.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a couple swigs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So that's also on the to-do list, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, if you don't want me to get too jittery, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Okay. So we'll do that first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A short time passes before the two platters are rushed over and scattered across the front of your table with a clattering. Pile of meats there set for you, a little bit placed on the side, because you might need, especially with the look on your face-- Adelaine gives you a glance and goes, "Put something in your belly." Comes back and slides two Trosts to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take the last piece.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's holding his hat in his grip, and he scans the room with an eager glance before his face brightens, and he begins to push his way across the room, in your direction, it looks like. He scoots over towards your table, and as you're about to turn and see what he's about--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm putting my hand on my purse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelps)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've just been sitting here this whole time!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You've met this man the day before, Rinaldo, the fisherman, who you had aided. And as he approaches, he goes, "Might I sit, please?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, take a seat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he sits down in his chair, I would ask each of you to please describe yourselves, starting with you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm having a good time, you know? We're just having a good time here at breakfast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. And you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can work with that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get to that. Thank you. And Travis, if you'd like to describe yourself, please?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm a half-orc, sitting here in beat-up leathers. Have a big scar across my face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sings 'Bad to the Bone') (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Green skin tone, and got some piecemeal armor put together and stuff. My name's Fjord.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very handsome. I just need to tell you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Appreciate that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Rinaldo sits down, clutching his hat still in his hands, says, "I thank you for your "time. Fjord. And, I apologize, I forget your names."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beauregard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beauregard. And?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Jester, thank you. You all came when no one else would yesterday, and because of you my "daughter is still alive."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah. Sorry for being a pessimistic asshole, by the way, when we first came into town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that's okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not used to things turning out good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sent you away with nothing but my gratitude. But "I've been asking around the other fishermen, lochsmen, and we've put together a little bit of "coin for your troubles, so." And he turns his cap over on the table, and this catches your attention, you hear this clattering of coin. Your eyes glance over, especially you, Nott, and watch as he leaves this pile of what looks to be mostly copper and silver pieces, with a couple of glimmers of gold, and as soon as it clatters across the hard wood table here in the center of the tavern, other faces begin to turn, gather attention as to what's happening over here in the back edge, and he takes his cap back and pushes it forward towards all of you, his dirty, you can see cracked and very callused fingers shoving it in your direction, before taking his hat and placing it back over his head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So cool!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those coins went all over the floor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But thank you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. Oh wait.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can't accept this, right? I mean, it's too much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're supposed to at least say that, right? And then still accept it, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you're supposed to do it if you say it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I mean, he did go around to a bunch of people. That was a lot of work on his part. I would hate to make him go back to all of those people and give it back to each individual person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fine, fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If he didn't keep a ledger, you know. We wouldn't want to do that. It's rude not to accept a gift, right? It's rude not to accept a gift, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much. I am sorry for getting in "your way." And he stands up and gives you all a nod and rushes out of the tavern, a little embarrassed by all the attention that's now placed on him by the other patrons, and as he leaves, everyone goes back to their business, a couple of wandering eyes starting to count what coins are there as you slowly mitt them in your direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Divide it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are four gold pieces amongst the pile, 22 silver, and 48 copper pieces.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I clock the room, see who else is watching her count?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check. 48 copper.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this the first roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First roll of the campaign.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's how you start it. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'm leaving it to you to do that counting. Which is really hard for me, personally, but there you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you split up four gold? We have four gold and there's only three of us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I actually did pretty good at that card game, so you can have mine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw. I will. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So two for each of us! That's great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. One for you, two for me, two for-- oh wait, no, wait, math doesn't make sense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's your treasurer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is going to go great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's hard not being the treasurer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll give two to Jester, one for you, one for me. And then 22 silver, that's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell you what, you do that math.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you're counting this out and figuring out the division of your gains, Fjord, you glance about, narrowing your orcish eyes across the room, and you can see two other tables there are some gentlemen who are peering over, and as soon as they meet your gaze, they go right back to their business and completely shrink away. There's a man and a hooded figure at a table immediately adjacent to you. The man looks rather filthy, his hair a bit unkempt, and he's trying to finish his drink. However, the smaller halfling-looking figure is just glaring intently, and is slowly leaning in the direction of the table.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's creepy. Fucking disgusting. I think we have people watching us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who is watching us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, just take a look right over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't arouse suspicion, but did you hear all that coin hit that table, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did. It's on the table, though, so I think on the table it will stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, but we could follow them out. We could do the Moneypot. We could run Rat Food. We could do Prince and the Pauper to get it from them. We could try Spider Eyes. Any of those could work--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you guys staying here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This blue-skinned tiefling suddenly leans over to you at the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't move. Don't move. Tieflings can only see movement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that's true--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's very true, we have a hard time seeing things that aren't moving, it's very true. But I can hear you. You should take a bath. You know they have showers here. It's possible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A what now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You bathe yourself in water.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I've bathed before, yeah, I know what a bath is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's because you smell really bad, and it's wafting over this direction. I'm just letting you know. I would hate if I smelled that bad and someone didn't tell me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've only just met you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi! I'm Jester.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi, I'm Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice to meet you, Caleb. How much silver did I just get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And 16 copper. Aren't you all jealous?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Morning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check, Beauregard and Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you checking your DnD Beyond specs?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am, I'm adding my--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22. I haven't even flipped over my character sheet yet. This is crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The somewhat meek female halfling who's now suddenly very reserved, and not as filthy as the human compatriot that she keeps, seems less and less halfling the more you glance in her direction. The ears are folded inward but elongated, the tinges of green to the skin, and with the little words that have poked through her lips, you can see what appear to be teeth more jagged than expected of the half-folk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just shout over and I say, good morning, in Halfling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you like a coffee? I'd love to buy you a coffee.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got-- free coffee? Yeah, yeah, I'll take it. Sure. Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're being mighty fucking friendly. They were looking at our coin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why can't they have been looking at me? Maybe they were looking at me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't think of that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe they were looking at you. As Jester said, you're handsome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said "Jest".

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just thought you said my name, is all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I said your name. Oh, they might have said your name, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never mind, never mind. Could I get another Trost over here, please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two, please, right away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually Adelaine comes by and brings two fresh Trosts to the table, glancing about at the unique tension in the air right here. "Would you like anything as well?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yes. Lots of baked goods if you have them, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pork belly, if you have it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think I've seen you eat anything other than pastries.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really like them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eat whatever you want. I'll have bacon, some ham, whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, pork it is. I'll be right back." She rushes off to the kitchen. You guys continue to awkwardly stare at each other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not for them, it's for farmers. Okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you're right, you're right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we notice them whispering?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With your perception rolls earlier? Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She rolled a 22.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But she can hear my little whisper?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you heard the whisper, you're not sure what the words are. You can see that they're whispering. Being mysterious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In Halfling, I'll say to Beau--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau for short works.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you in town for business or pleasure?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I insight check him, see what he's hiding?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. What's my insight, I can't remember.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is he saying? I mean you, you're a girl. What is she saying? Shit. That's really hard to remember now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're asking me what I'm saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, what did you just say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? I mean, seems to be genuine. Hard to read through all the wrappings, shadow, and the hood still obscuring the face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have the mask covering you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's this porcelain covering that has painted lips. It's a little unsettling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I'm sorry, not to be blunt, but, you know. It's pretty obvious goblins are not welcome strolling about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's a goblin?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, but you don't have to make a big thing of it, all right? There could be people here who don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's why she's wrapped up. Just leave it, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't ask why she was wrapped up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, we're not making a big deal out it. You're making a big deal out of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody asked why she was wrapped up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, nobody asked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody said the words-- this is Liam-- "Why are you all wrapped up?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's concern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Caleb finishes oversharing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vaxleth is over. It's so over!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those are old times, man. That was a different universe. Different life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The figures, one eclipsing the other from behind, begin to step in. You notice one of them begins to step from table to table, glancing about with a sort of grace to the movement, the other staying a few feet behind. Taliesin, if you'd like to describe your character, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't think we were going to meet you so soon!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Neither did I.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But here we are. A lavender-- damn it, Travis. A lavender tiefling with red eyes and very pierced, extremely ostentatious horns that are pierced with little gems and little baubles. He's got a tattoo that seems to be running up the side of his face, a peacock tattoo that goes off into his very ostentatious, ridiculous, overblown robes that he wears. His two swords and pouch dangling at the side of his hips. He's very broad in his dress.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So a literal and figurative peacock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One of your characters? No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, mine. Who knew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this tiefling darts from table to table, a few feet behind, you see--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, did you say your name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't say my name.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Her clothes are a bit tattered, but just sort of-- she's a bit of a mess, and she has two different color eyes. One of them is a light greenish-blue, and the other is a violet color. And she's very standoffish, hunch-y, arms folded.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as these figures slowly move from table to table, the tiefling engaging in some distant conversation, leaving a slip of paper, walking to the next table. Gauging the atmosphere, not leaving a slip of paper, and quickly moving on, and then eventually your eyes meet what looks to be two tables with a very motley crew of individuals that are both awkwardly avoiding their own tension and currently trying to figure you out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I tell if-- where are they in the dispensement of the coin? Can I tell they have a little coin on them? Did I catch any of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've completed distributing, so you don't see any coin, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well. I don't believe I've ever seen a group of people more in need of a good time in my entire life. Mollymauk Tealeaf of the Fletching and Moondrop Traveling Carnival of Curiosities. If there was ever a group of people that needed a good time to go out, have a laugh, see things that you have never seen before, and my god, take my word for it, one month's time, people will be buying your ale to hear the tale of what you saw at the Traveling Carnival of Curiosities this night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We saw your tent going up! We did!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were actually going to go without the flyer, but now we also have a flyer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just five copper. A steal. At five silver, it would be a steal, at five gold? Worth every penny. But if you've got the five copper to spend, we would happily have you all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you perform?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah. I'm less of a performer and more of an intermediary for these parts. I do on occasion perform. I can read fortunes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) I was going to ask if you read fortunes! Can you do one now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I knew you were going to ask that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh my gosh, you're so smart. Look at this guy, he knows everything!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to sit down at the table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Miss, can I get you a drink?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (deadpan) Yes could I have a drink, please. Just some ale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Coming right up. Any preferences for the family? Baumbauch?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stay clear of Baumbauch. They're dicks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's kind of true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just a big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Husseldorf, then. All right. Be right back." And she wanders off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well. Who has coin for a fortune?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know my name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is your name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jester.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know your name now!

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: (laugh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is your name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, my name is Molly to my friends, and we're friends, now, aren't we? Pleasure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Molly. Look at this guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mollymauk. Molly for short. This is Yasha, she's a charm.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yasha. Yasha.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now. Would anyone like a fortune read?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would love one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have coin?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. How much do you want?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two copper.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark down your two copper. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am taking this in. All right. (sighs) I'm going to try and do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as he pulls out a small set of cards and begins to shuffle them, go ahead and roll an insight check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's do a 16 there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you get a brief conversation here, you get a pretty solid read: the excitability, the eagerness, and the exuberant interest in just getting in your face that this person wants-- any fortune you tell will probably suffice. Go ahead and roll a sleight-of-hand check as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look at this fucking game! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And you feel pretty confident that her eyes are locked onto your eyes at the moment and not the deck, as you set up a proper reading. And the cards are shuffled, set, you place them before you, and you may give your fortune.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to just keep my eyes open for any tricks of the hand, sleight-of-hand-y-type tricks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Perception. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. All right. Everything seems pretty above-board.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your first card, the Silver Dragon. This is good. You're pure, you're virtue, you are a worthwhile and wonderful human being, obviously, or creature of some repute.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what everyone always tells me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's true. And heading towards the Anvil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a destiny forged.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (deadpan) Ohh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is something bright and adventurous in your future.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow! You know, we did just defeat a really big snake? So maybe there's even bigger things coming up, you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I make another roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, easy enough. Even with discerning eyes at the table, you are at the top of your game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Serpent card appears. Of course you did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh my gosh! Look at that! How did you even do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's all the cards. I'm simply a vessel for higher powers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While everybody's watching this shit happen, may I cast Detect Magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may. You lean back and subtly begin a brief muttering of an incantation, your fingers wash through the air, a faint silver gleam across your fingertips. Nothing magical shows up in the immediate vicinity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will you ask the cards if I'm going to find him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you're going to find her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give me a little bit more. Who's this 'him' that you're looking for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm looking for my dad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You fumble for a second, but the card still finds its way through without issue.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pushing through, pushing through. The Eye card pulls up. You've already found the clue you're looking for. You just don't know what it is yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Apparently. Well, it's what the cards are saying. It's right in front of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Does it say how long ago I found it? Because that's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sadly, I don't have that sort of specifics. That's much more expensive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's going to take a lot of thinking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, you find us at the show, you'll find my tent and I'd be happy to give you a more complicated reading.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't wait! It's going to be so much fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So much fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha, at this point, the barmaid, Adelaine, comes up and hands you the ordered ale.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you, my lady.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "On the house."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On the house!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's very kind of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you perform in the circus, too?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I do not. I just-- I put it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The tent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a big tent. It would take a lot of work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm very strong. But I don't do anything in the show.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some of our acts are a little complicated, with performers who are not of the traditional variety. Can make some of the locals get a little shifty, if you know what I mean, and it's good to have a few people around who are capable of keeping issues contained.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that why it says 'No admittance to the elderly'? You don't want to deal with those riley elderly. Or the ill, yeah. Why no elderly, though? Ill kind of makes sense, but elderly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We cannot be held responsible for anything that may happen to someone who is ill or infirm. It is such an exciting, impressive show.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. It's just that exciting. Just from excitement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did they die in the show, or from watching it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, just like heart attack. Just from getting so excited, I guess.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We gotta get so wasted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When is it? How long is it? When is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is actually the day of Grissen, and your first show is today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First show is tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we have plans tonight!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you stinky people want to come with us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I-- Caleb, we don't have any plans tonight. I guess we could go along. I wouldn't mind seeing it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It'll be fun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you could stay here and buy beer for the people who do see the shows, and you can hear all about it and pay more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we can go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be so much fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at all these friends we're making here. This is a good city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are all the most charming people I've met in-- yes. I finish my beer. (sighs) Well, we'd better be getting on.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yep, nice to meet you all. You're so, uh, wonderful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Charm. Pure charm. See you tonight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as they leave you, Yasha just downs her entire ale, slams it on the table, and they both walk out, passing a couple more flyers at off tables, and then exit out to the rest of the day's sun beyond your sight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She didn't say much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's why I liked her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She was really, really cool. Did you see that cool thing she had going on with her chin? That's interesting. I wish I would have thought of something like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, you could maybe do something like that in time. Just wait until maybe--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she doesn't know I copied. I can't do it tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Cool. What do you guys want to do now? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was he using magic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you-- you're superstitious. Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm not superstitious at all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You-- sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's a smart guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By the way, did you open your Christmas present from me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, not yet, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should go open it! Yes! Go grab the bag!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On the break. On the break, I'll grab it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Matt. Dungeon master. They're wearing what they described. They're not wearing any cloaks or anything right now, are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them have small cloaks over the shoulders, Beau has a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I recognize those cloaks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you do not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Why would you recognize the cloaks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe I saw something. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you do not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't see them last night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Interesting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mysteries.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, for the record, there was nothing magic about that. Maybe he's good at reading people, but that was not magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb knows everything about magic. He's been even teaching me some. He's real good. You should see him--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb, are you going to go the Academy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (strained laugh) That's silly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He could if he wanted to. He's really good at magic. He can make a cat appear and disappear whenever he wants.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? A cat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (snaps)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as just beneath the table, this orange patchy tabby leaps up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit! What's his name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or her name!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw! Can I call him Lumpy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can call him Frumpkin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a little show gift from Marisha, so this is Frumpkin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not all he can do. Caleb, tell them all the stuff you can do. It's really impressive!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, sometimes less is more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can do things, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With magic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not to me, not to me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like-- oh, gosh. Okay. I'm going to use Thaumaturgy and I'm going to make all the windows in the place open up really fast, like crash open.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch as four of the nearby windows slam open with a sudden burst of wind, and all the various bits of torchlight that light the deeper and more shadowed corners of the room suddenly darken and flicker. The music suddenly comes to a stop. Everyone holds their position and glances over at the table where you're all sitting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, don't you remember us talking about keeping a low profile?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all slam shut a second time. The light flickers and then brightens back to its normal place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ta-da!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come see me tonight at the carnival! I'm really good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One really crotchety-looking guy in his early 50s with a super underbite, probably missing most of his teeth, just goes-- (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I telepathically tell Frumpkin to jump up and sit in the lap of the woman in the monk's robes who just made a big scene and hopefully keep her occupied with being cute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As soon as you sit down, Frumpkin leaps into your lap and starts purring and rubbing up against your hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, buddy. Look at this kitty! I think he likes me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, right now he likes you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this a real cat? Or is this a fake cat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you mean, a fake cat?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a magic cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's both a real cat and a magic cat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is he an illusion cat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you feel him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could you put him over there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you allergic to Frumpkins? Oh no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he's a magic cat. How can you be allergic to magic cats?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm pretty sure he's a real fucking cat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's one of those hypoallergenic magic cats.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what the Fifth Edition rules are--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: --for cat dander?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know right now? Yeah, he's having an actual allergic attack. A minor one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I walk away a little bit from Fjord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you're both magic-users, then. And so is the larger fellow?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I mean, a little.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, he's learning. He's getting really good at it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trying to learn more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you should have seen him. He disguised himself the other day, and it was like, (clicks tongue).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks, Jester. She's better at it than I am. We're trying to make our way up to the Academy to get a little bit more learning done.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he's going to learn. I'm not going to go to the Academy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, this Academy place keeps getting brought up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well yeah, it's the place to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, what Academy are we talking about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Solstryce Academy. You know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Soltryce.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Soul Train Academy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a very fancy place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have heard of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you have arcane talents as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long have you had yours?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a tricky question. I studied when I was younger, and then I gave it up for a while. I picked it up again recently. It's all book-learned.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, that's cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This was a good way to go for your first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A frickin' cat!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is kind of therapeutic. Making me feel better, just about life in general.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He reads lots of books, Caleb does. He's very smart. In fact, should we go looking for more right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe in a little while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see one of your books?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well-- and I pull apart the lapels of my coat. I have books in what modern-day people like to think of as holster-straps, but there's a book hanging here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think ancient people would call it a holster as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bap-bap-bap. The books are right here. I have these, but these are heirlooms, family heirlooms, so I don't share those, but-- no, I like to read. That's all. And I'm a bit of a self-starter, so I have to find-- I mean, good luck at the Academy. That's rough, I hear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know anything about it? We're just going up. Beginner's luck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We know it's rich people that go there. We have to find a way to get you in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All I know is how hard it is to get into.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have a lot of money, then?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We had more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But then we lost it, but then we got it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Somebody has a gambling problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Which one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's the name of it again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is the Crick-Queen's Call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you played it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I haven't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll teach you someday. It's so much fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a game?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cards? All right. I might like to know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can teach you, if you want.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I would like to know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll deal!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, sure, this will be fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen, I would not be sitting here if it were not for you. Do whatever you like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. You draw three cards. Well, I give you three cards. So you use 3d6.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So hide your roll from me, because we can't know. So first you have to ante up. How much coin do you want to put in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all right. I will front some coin for you to play this game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, great! How much do you want to front him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will give you a silver piece.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A silver. Okay, this is great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Caleb. Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wish I had more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Am I doing this right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So far.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now I'm going to give us three cards, so we both roll, but we can't see. That's good. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't say 'that's good'.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bluffing. How do you know I wasn't?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to change one of my cards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, wait, there's rules!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Without you seeing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 12 plus eight, so that's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is really hard, Sam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're only an hour and a half in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is my only skill, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But, you know, that's my skill, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'm going to try to do it as well, 'cause that's my skill as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, first, what'd you roll for--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did not notice him doing it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, so you only get to reroll one of the dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so I'm going to try to reroll one of my three, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead. So make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. Oh, shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I notice her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, roll a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I rolled three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So the best hand you can get is three of a kind. Then, after that, it's a straight. A high straight. Then a low straight. Then it's if you get all evens, or if you get all odds, then it's two of a kind, then it's nothing, it's just high card. Okay, but now we put in a second amount, because you can up the ante, and you get one more card.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You get to give a card back, and then I deal you another card.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I? Caleb, do you have any more?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because you saved my life yesterday, you may have one more silver piece.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One more silver. Okay, I'll keep it low, too, because you're only doing the one. So I only put in one silver, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a four-silver pot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. And now give one of your dice back, whichever one you don't want, and roll it again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get to reroll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you get to reroll one as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to reroll any. Okay. Now you show what you got and we'll see who wins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got a pair of fours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got three fives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I immediately grapple him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check. You make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Acrobatics? 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the female goblin draws a shortsword. You reach out to grab, and she slips out of your grasp and is now holding the blade at the edge of the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're cheating. Somehow you're cheating.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, Nott, that's fine. That's fine. She won my two silver pieces. We'll just leave it at that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay. She's very jumpy sometimes. You can understand; we've been living in the woods for a long time. Every time we come near any place like this, we're attacked, jumped, followed. So I apologize on behalf of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was stupid. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have done that. I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's okay. Just don't do it again. But I'm sorry I took all this money from your friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's making it worse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe you could give some of it back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why, though? But I won it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell you what. I'll give you-- none of it back, I can't! Okay, here's one silver back--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I insist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, but I insist, all the money back. All right, fine, it's mine, thank you. Yay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need another drink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A round of Trosts for both our tables, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See? Isn't that the most fun?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yorda looks over and goes, "Any preference of family?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not Baumbauch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Von Brandt it is."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm impressed that you stuck to taking a guy's money in a training game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? Oh, wait, is that bad?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Meh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I only learned last night, you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is a training game?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just meaning when she was teaching.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: People took my money when I was learning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's fine. It's water under the bridge. It's fine. It's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another round is brought to your table. You guys can share a solemn post-game drink amongst yourselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you feel slightly worse, there's a drink on me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have my baked goods come out yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They have. Your meal's been presented for a while now. You've had the opportunity to eat most of your meal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's real.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is actually real. That's the power of imagination, Sam. That wasn't there a second ago.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right there for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you all finish your independent meals and decide to continue your conversations or go about your business for the day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just want to go to the carnival.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's later tonight, though, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have no other business, we can wait until dusk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, there's that board on the wall. Has anything new been posted on the board?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and take a look at it. There is one sheet that pertains to somebody in the Hills Ward looking for folks to go ahead and do an extermination run near the southern portion of the Ustaloch. It looks like there's what looks to be a vole infestation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck is a vole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a small rat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we do it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we have to kill Rodents of Unusual Size.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That doesn't sound interesting to me at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, it looks like there was another sheet that looks like most has been torn off. The rest of the board is pretty empty at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM, did I tear that? I can't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wasn't it a delivery thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was what it was, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was to help move and load crates at one of the local breweries.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've done that. It sucked so much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, by mistake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We did, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to level two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We said no to that job, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We get bored pretty easily.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did, however, then gamble with the other workers and then Jester-- yeah. Jester--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I lost it, but he made so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not out loud say that. Just a thought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We didn't make any money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you guys want company? Do you want us to come and hang out with you today?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know about that. That sounds risky, I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know something? I, shockingly, think that's not a bad idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To have these weirdos with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can hear you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yesterday was a very bad day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Well, I suppose if we surrounded ourselves with weirdos, then maybe it would take some of heat off of me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, yes. Bottom line: can you hang with the goblin?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bottom line-- and I touch Nott's shoulder, and I cast Blessing of the Trickster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will mourn her. Tschuss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so there's a slight sense of warmth that emanates from under her hand, and for a moment, you look over and glance instinctively, ready to almost draw your sword again. But it seems to quicken your reflexes. You have this surge of adrenaline that doesn't quite fade.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have advantage on all your stealth checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the next hour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. That's very nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't have a problem with goblins, but you guys aren't in any trouble, are you? No one's after you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because she is all kinds of trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one is after me!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I make an insight check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. If you want to go ahead and try and lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a 14, except negative three to performance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been waiting for this for so long.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, are you lying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am lying. I am definitely on the run from someone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So. Mask. I'm just fascinated by the mask. Looks well-made. Did you make it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't make things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I presume-- and we discussed this a little bit-- we presume it may have been scavenged from a porcelain doll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's cool. Cool and gross, cool and gross.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's her name? The creepy doll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, don't say that. I don't want to see art with you with Annabelle's face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Too late.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The internet's running with that now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check your Twitter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It seems we have all day. What were your plans?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not much. We were going to sample the different Trosts, and I wanted to maybe do some book browsing. Nothing major.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's a Trost?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Brewery tour!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's ale.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just can't go by the Baumbauch ale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What happened with the Baumbauchs?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are two others to choose from, here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're who we loaded crates for, and then we kind of swindled their employee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't leave on the best of terms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM, which one is the one that everybody knows has got the blessing of Fryda Langer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that is actually the Baumbauch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the Starosta is kind of tied with the Baumbauch family.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're imaginary beer snobs now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that the one you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm just saying the one that you swindled, it's got the blessing of the big cheese here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well. Why do you need it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't need it. It's just pleasurable to have a Trost, is what they say. She kind of needs it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need it a little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need a beer?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So beer tour, then circus?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to say, I miss those two people we ran into at the carnival.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might just wait for the carnival, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, if we just montage through a beer tour, we'll quickly get to the circus. To the carnival!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can totally do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we just bring my book-browsing down to a single roll to see if anything of use--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we can do that. We'll say, if you guys decide to go ahead and travel, the five of you, you make your way through the town for the day, you coast around the Husseldorf family brewery, you meet Voss and June, who are the two very nice ladies who run the facility. The Husseldorf family. You avoid the Baumbauch, but can acquire Baumbauch ale from other taverns in the town, of course. And the von Brandt family brewery. All of them, as soon as you say 'Trost', they correct you and say the family name. They're very intent on getting rid of the name 'Trost' as an overall, discussion of Trost-brand brews, and trying to make it their family name. There's an offense, to the point where you're like, "Oh, Jesus. I didn't realize."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like Kleenex and tissue paper? All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you manage to get nice and sauced throughout the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take it easy. I have one more in the first half of the day, and one in the second half.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have very much either.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to have tons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get sauced.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, well, that being the case--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --you are poisoned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that was crazy. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, okay. You get a little woozy for a while, and as the sun begins to crawl towards the distant horizon, you do not manage to allow your meal to usurp your control.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, it's like Ren Faire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Don't remind me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good times, good times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as the day comes to a close, you're fairly tipsy, you're not fully intoxicated. For your trip, you wanted to head to the Hillsbrook Parchment and Binding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that where I went the last time? Except not as myself. So I'll go as myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Don't fuck me, Vax. That is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's Vax. That's Vax's dice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's more of a discussion of the political structure that maintains all the city-states there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the person who ran this place was an older man, right? Just sipping tea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Sheenah, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you mind if I ask-- I haven't seen any other booksellers of any kind in town. I'm not really looking for anything on farming, so much. Is there anywhere else I could look into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you're looking for some sort of a library, your best bet is to go to Zadash up north."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zadash.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's where the Library of the Cobalt Soul resides. They have all the information you could "hope for. A bit pricey to peruse their interior, unless you have proper coverage, but unfortunately "if what we have isn't what you're looking for, I can't help you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's a fine selection. Sorry. How much for this book on hoe technique?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! Jamieson's Hoedown, yes, quite. That will be two silver pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. I'm very embarrassed, I'm sorry, I gave away my last two silver pieces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I gave it back to you, remember?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe I can earn it back and come back later this week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please do. Do you want me to hold it for you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My name is Caleb Widogast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. I will keep it here under the shelf. Thank you so much."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, good day, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this a big shop?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a boutique. It's designed almost like a cross. There's two cross-sections of hallways that have books across the walls, and there's a window at the end of each and then a door at the far back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While he was talking to the shopkeeper, I'm going to take out as many books as I can and move them around on the shelves, and then take some of them and turn them around to where their binding is facing the inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over the period of him searching and distracting this man, you have completely rearranged the interior of this bookstore, to the point where even in the far corner, you Ghostbusters stack them in the center of the room, floor-to-ceiling, with him not even noticing it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You little fucking poltergeist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel confident and happy and a sensation of approval washes over you. All right, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I skip out the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You turn around from having this conversation and notice the interior is not as you last saw it, and a bit of nerves begin to brew up under you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin, come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (meows) Frumpkin follows behind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yes! Matt's got to make cat sounds now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: God damn it. All right, so as you guys have gathered at this point, the oranges and the pinks of dusk begin to peek through the quite-cloudy sky, the chilled air of the coming night sky signalling the Crown's Guard to begin lighting the hanging lanterns that line the streets of Trostenwald. A renewed energy takes the streets as the sound of a fiddle seems to creep through the night air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My god, Ashley's a master fiddler, isn't she?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love how your fiddle noises were "beedle-deedle".

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's the sound for all instruments, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Drums.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the way, DM, can I ask-- sometime in the entire day, when Nott was getting wasted, could I have spent an hour using Arcane Recovery to gain back that one spell slot I used this morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you all follow?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I cast Blessing of the Trickster on you again, just in case.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Children laugh and chatter excitedly, while the Crown's Guard in their familiar bronze and vermilion uniform try to maintain order between themselves being quite curious or visibly mistrusting of these hooligans that suddenly have usurped the evening air. The procession continues towards the eastern side, out along the southern edge of this Loch Ward, to the Ustaloch's southern place, towards the new, completely constructed, large, dark blue tent. Lengthy streamers of white and silver flap with the cold winds from the top of the structure. As you guys walk, you watch as the horned tiefling you had approached earlier slowly saunters up to your side, you recognizing these individuals you had spoken with earlier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go, Molly! Molly, hey!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it's my favorites. Hello.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We came!

lines.name: TALIESIN
